metadata.Title: CVE-2018-9838 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The caml_ba_deserialize function in byterun/bigarray.c in the standard library in OCaml 4.06.0 has an integer overflow which, in situations where marshalled data is accepted from an untrusted source, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted object. It was discovered that OCaml mishandled crafted input. An attacker could use this vulnerability to cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-9838` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ocaml - 4.02.3-5ubuntu2+esm1
ocaml-base - 4.02.3-5ubuntu2+esm1
ocaml-base-nox - 4.02.3-5ubuntu2+esm1
ocaml-compiler-libs - 4.02.3-5ubuntu2+esm1
ocaml-interp - 4.02.3-5ubuntu2+esm1
ocaml-mode - 4.02.3-5ubuntu2+esm1
ocaml-native-compilers - 4.02.3-5ubuntu2+esm1
ocaml-nox - 4.02.3-5ubuntu2+esm1
ocaml-source - 4.02.3-5ubuntu2+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: msalvatore> binaries built with ocamlopt will need to be rebuilt after a system upgrade

criterions.comment: ocaml package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.02.3-5ubuntu2+esm1').
